text: The Ven. John Hall (1626-1691) was a Church of Ireland priest in the 17th century and early 18th century.Handbook of British Chronology By Fryde, E. B;. Greenway, D.E;Porter, S; Roy, I: Cambridge, CUP, 1996 , 0713642556 An Englishman, Hall was educated at Trinity College, Dublin."Alumni Dublinenses : a register of the students, graduates, professors and provosts of Trinity College in the University of Dublin (1593–1860) George Dames Burtchaell/Thomas Ulick Sadleir p357: Dublin, Alex Thom and Co, 1935 He was ordained on 31 March 1667. In 1667 he became Archdeacon of Killaloe"Fasti Ecclesiae Hibernicae: The succession of the prelates Volume 1" Cotton,H. p486 Dublin, Hodges & Smith, 1848–1878 and in 1668 Precentor of Leighlin. ==Notes== Category:1626 births Category:1691 deaths Category:Archdeacons of Killaloe Category:17th-century Irish Anglican priests Category:18th-century Irish Anglican priests Category:Alumni of Trinity College Dublin Category:Clergy from Dublin (city)
title: John Hall (Archdeacon of Killaloe)
